availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A public mental health institution located in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky. Established in 1824 in the building formerly known as Fayette Hospital. Civil War-era Superintendents: Dr. John Rowan Allen (1844-1854); Dr. William S. Chipley (1854-1869).

ab.bibl:
“Eastern State Hospital" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 279.
Alma Wynelle Deese, Kentucky’s First Asylum (Bloomington, IN: iUniverse, Inc., 2012).
